intro: Jamesianthus alabamensis, commonly known as the Alabama sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as woodlands and prairies. It is often found in the coastal plain regions of Alabama and Florida. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
